TITLE: Million-dollar homes losing luxury status as buyers get less space for their money, research finds
SUMMARY: Money does not go as far for home size at any price point nowadays, according to Zillow. The $1 million price threshold in particular is losing its cachet.

TITLE: 1 in 5 home sellers are now dropping their asking price as the housing market cools
SUMMARY: The average home sold for less than its list price for the first time in more than 17 months during the four-week period ended Aug. 28, according to Redfin.

TITLE: Chinese stocks could plunge by 20% if real estate troubles get much worse, Morgan Stanley says
SUMMARY: China's real estate problems could significantly drag down the economy and stocks if authorities don't provide enough support, Morgan Stanley analysts said.

TITLE: Bank of America launches zero down payment mortgages to help minorities buy their first homes — here's who can apply
SUMMARY: Bank of America is working to narrow the homeownership gap among minority communities in certain cities with new mortgage products that come with fewer strings.

TITLE: Flood losses to insured property are jumping drastically and only a small fraction of what's damaged by floods is insured
SUMMARY: A new report from insurance giant Swiss Re finds the flood losses to insured property are jumping drastically and only a fraction of what's damaged is insured.

TITLE: Largest-ever geothermal grid under this Texas housing development is saving homeowners serious money
SUMMARY: Geothermal heating and cooling is achieved by accessing the constant temperatures deep underground and then using water to circulate that temperature up above.

TITLE: Mortgage demand falls even further, as rates shoot back up to July highs
SUMMARY: After falling earlier this month, mortgage rates began rising again to the highest level since mid-July. That caused mortgage demand to pull back even further.

TITLE: Home prices weakened in June, but were still much higher than a year ago, says S&P Case-Shiller
SUMMARY: Home prices in June were 18% higher than during the same month last year, according to the S&P CoreLogic Case-Shiller Indices.

TITLE: Mortgage rates will fall to 4.5% in 2023? That's the estimate from Fannie Mae. Here’s what that means for homebuyers
SUMMARY: Fannie Mae says mortgage rates could fall to 4.5% next year. But prospective homebuyers shouldn't use predictions as a primary guide to purchase decisions.

TITLE: The rent crisis on Main Street just took a turn for the worse
SUMMARY: The percentage of small business owners who said they could not make rent in August hit a record level for 2022, and hasn't been this high since peak Covid.

TITLE: Mortgage denial rate for Black borrowers is twice that of overall population, report finds
SUMMARY: Progress in giving aspiring Black homebuyers more equal footing compared to the overall population has been slow and incremental, one expert says.

TITLE: Beyond student loan forgiveness, here's what the government can do to keep the rising household debt in check
SUMMARY: Policy plays a vital role in keeping the rising household debt in check.

TITLE: Pending home sales slip 1% in July, but Realtors say market may be 'at or close to the bottom'
SUMMARY: Pending home sales, a measure of signed contracts on existing homes, dropped 1% from June to July, according to the National Association of Realtors.

TITLE: Home prices fell for the first time in 3 years last month – and it was the biggest decline since 2011
SUMMARY: The sharp and fast rise in mortgage rates this year caused an already pricey housing market to become even less affordable.

TITLE: Vacation rental company Vacasa picks protege of Uber CEO to be next chief executive
SUMMARY: Vacasa picked Rob Greyber, who led Expedia's Egencia division from 2009 to 2020, to succeed current Chief Executive Matt Roberts.

TITLE: First-time buyers show more demand for mortgages, even as interest rates rise
SUMMARY: Mortgage demand from first-time buyers rose despite a sharp increase in mortgage interest rates.

TITLE: 72% of recent homebuyers have regrets about their purchases. As the market cools, these steps can help you avoid disappointment
SUMMARY: The hot seller's market in recent years prompted buyers to go above and beyond to seal the deals on their prospective homes, a recent survey finds.

TITLE: Apartment rents are finally easing after an incredible run. Here's how to play it
SUMMARY: Rent growth for apartments looks to have peaked after a tremendous run in 2021, and that could boost some real estate stocks.

TITLE: We're in a 'housing recession,' experts say. Here's what that means for homeowners, sellers and buyers
SUMMARY: While home sales last month were down more than 20% from a year earlier, prices are up more than 10% and demand remains strong despite a slowdown.

TITLE: Trump PAC paid nearly $1 million to defense lawyers in July alone as Georgia and New York probes heated up
SUMMARY: Since May, former President Donald Trump's political action committee, Save America, has nearly quintupled spending on defense attorneys.

TITLE: $14.9M palatial estate in Connecticut priced to break local record
SUMMARY: The brick-and-limestone residence, built in 1929, is the most expensive home for sale in New Canaan with a $14.9 million price tag.

TITLE: Delta, the NFL, and the U.S. Air Force are turning to this app to prepare for extreme weather
SUMMARY: Tomorrow.io aims to tell customers how extreme weather will affect them while there's still time to prepare.

TITLE: The modern family: 18% of Americans live in multigenerational households. For this N.J. family, it was ‘a lifesaver’ during the pandemic
SUMMARY: Multigenerational living has risen sharply over the past five decades and shows no sign of slowing down.

TITLE: Home Depot and Lowe's cite strong demand in earnings reports, but softening could be ahead
SUMMARY: Even as homebuilder sentiment dropped, Home Depot and Lowe's saw continued strong demand from contractors.

TITLE: Home sales fell nearly 6% in July as housing market slides into a recession
SUMMARY: Sales of previously owned homes fell nearly 6% in July compared with June, according to a monthly report from the National Association of Realtors.

TITLE: Chinese property developers' cash flows have plunged by more than 20%
SUMMARY: Chinese property developers' cash flows — a sign of the companies' ability to stay afloat — have plunged this year, according to Oxford Economics.

TITLE: Mortgage demand fell last week even as rates declined slightly
SUMMARY: A small drop in mortgage rates was not enough to fuel any kind of recovery in consumer demand for home loans.

TITLE: Homebuyers are backing out of more deals as high mortgage rates persist and recession fears linger
SUMMARY: Homebuilder cancellation rates have more than doubled since April, according to surveys by John Burns Real Estate Consulting.

TITLE: 4 takeaways from the Investing Club’s ‘Morning Meeting’ on Monday
SUMMARY: The Investing Club holds its "Morning Meeting" livestream every weekday at 10:20 a.m. ET.

TITLE: More than 100 million Americans will be exposed to extreme heat by 2053, mostly in the South and Midwest
SUMMARY: Next year, about 50 U.S. counties, which are home to more than 8 million residents, are expected to feel heat index temperatures above 125 degrees Fahrenheit.
